definition: abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: It's much easier to go abroad than before.
sentences.chinese: 如今出國比以前超卓多了。

sentences.english: I commanded the voice before terror could incapacitate me.
sentences.chinese: 我趕在恐懼擊倒我以前對那個聲音下令。

sentences.english: The maggots also provide a cool, pre-industrial expiration date.
sentences.chinese: 而這蛆還有一個很酷的，工業化以前的終止日期。

sentences.english: No one’s ever looked at the brain waves before with human-animal interaction.
sentences.chinese: 以前從沒有人就人與動物的互動來觀察人類的腦電波。

sentences.english: My former house has turned into a wreck of tumbled walls.
sentences.chinese: 以前的房子現在已經變成頹垣斷壁了。

sentences.english: The two-humped camel of central Asia was also domesticated long ago.
sentences.chinese: 中亞的雙峯駱駝，很早以前就被馴化。

sentences.english: A couple of years ago, though, curiosity overcame caution.
sentences.chinese: 可是，數年以前，我的好奇心戰勝了謹慎。

sentences.english: So the salmon that return here are fish that were released from here.
sentences.chinese: 所以回到這裏的三文魚都是我們以前從這裏放生的。

sentences.english: Well, it’s just that your mom was always bugging you about it.
sentences.chinese: 我想大概是你媽媽以前總在在你耳邊嘮叨的關係吧。

sentences.english: So I had a wife, beautiful; like you.
sentences.chinese: 喔我以前有個老婆，很漂亮，就像你。

sentences.english: But Ryan Reser of the U.S. judo team has never been to the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 但是這位美國柔道選手以前從來沒有參加過奧運比賽。

sentences.english: I did the payroll in the job I had before that.
sentences.chinese: 在那以前的工作中我做過工資表。

sentences.english: Long, long ago, there is a student who likes to travel.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有個讀書人喜歡遊山玩水。

sentences.english: Today I believe that to be truer than ever.
sentences.chinese: 現在我比以前更相信這一點。

sentences.english: Pregnancy has you looking better than ever
sentences.chinese: 你懷孕後看起來比以前任何時候都美。

definition: original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
